labels.analysis: The MCP Server primarily focuses on providing web search and local search capabilities through Brave's search engine. The available tools enable users to perform web searches as well as search for local businesses and places, returning detailed information such as addresses, ratings, phone numbers, and opening hours. The server is designed to handle queries implying location-based searches and falls back to web search when local results are unavailable.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around enabling web searches. The secondary label "Travel & Maps" is selected due to the local search capability, which is directly related to finding businesses and places, akin to travel and navigation applications. There is no need for a custom label as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Brave Search
server_info_crawled.author: @smithery-ai/brave-search
server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate web search and local search capabilities with Brave.

tools.name: brave_web_search
tools.description: Deploy Server Brave Search @smithery-ai/brave-search Try in Playground brave_web_search

tools.name: brave_local_search
tools.description:
Searches for local businesses and places using Brave's Local Search API. Best for queries related to physical locations, businesses, restaurants, services, etc. Returns detailed information including:
- Business names and addresses
- Ratings and review counts
- Phone numbers and opening hours
Use this when the query implies 'near me' or mentions specific locations. Automatically falls back to web search if no local results are found.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@smithery-ai/brave-search/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: braveApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The API key for the BRAVE Search server.
